New Records: South Africa won the match by 229 runs.
Heinrich Klaasen scored 109 runs off 67 balls.
Marco Jansen hit an unbeaten 75 and took 2/35.
Reeza Hendricks scored 85 runs off 75 balls with nine fours and three sixes.
Rassie van der Dussen contributed with a quick 50.
Key Match Events: Kagiso Rabada took an absolute stunner off the bowling of Lungi Ngidi to dismiss David Willey.
South Africa's pace attack ran through England's batting line-up under lights.
England's top order struggled to convert starts, with Jonny Bairstow's tough catch being a turning point.
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa made changes to their lineup with Temba Bavuma missing due to illness.
England boosted their lineup with the return of Ben Stokes, David Willey, and Gus Atkinson.
Both teams were coming off shock losses to Netherlands and Afghanistan, respectively.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's win was seen as a turning point in their World Cup campaign.
England's performance was criticized, with questions about their batting depth.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's Reece Topley suffered a finger injury, forcing him off the field early.
The match was played under normal conditions with no significant interruptions.
